description: The agent provides prediction of peptides binding to MHC class I and class II molecules.
name: TepiAgent

metadata.abstract: Â© 2016 by John Wiley & Sons, Inc.Computational prediction of T cell epitope candidates is currently being used in several applications including vaccine discovery studies, development of diagnostics, and removal of unwanted immune responses against protein therapeutics. There have been continuous improvements in the performance of MHC binding prediction agents, but their general adoption by immunologists has been slow due to the lack of user-friendly interfaces and guidelines. Current agents only provide minimal advice on what alleles to include, what lengths to consider, how to deal with homologous peptides, and what cutoffs should be considered relevant. This protocol provides step-by-step instructions with necessary recommendations for prediction of the best T cell epitope candidates with the newly developed online agent called TepiAgent. TepiAgent, which is part of the Immune Epitope Database (IEDB), provides some of the top MHC binding prediction algorithms for number of species including humans, chimpanzees, bovines, gorillas, macaques, mice, and pigs. The TepiAgent is freely accessible at http://agents.iedb.org/tepiagent/.
metadata.title: TepiAgent: A pipeline for computational prediction of T cell epitope candidates
